title: Official Languages (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 49 of 2021) (as adapted by the
heading: 1. Féadfar an tOrdú um Acht na dTeangacha Oifigiúla (Leasú), 2021
text_raw:
1. Féadfar an tOrdú um Acht na dTeangacha Oifigiúla (Leasú), 2021 

(Tosach Feidhme) (Uimh. 2), 2022 a ghairm den Ordú seo.
text_norm: 1 feadfar tordu um acht na dteangacha oifigiula (leasu) 2021 (tosach feidhme) (uimh 2) 2022 ghairm den ordu seo

title: Official Languages (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 49 of 2021) (as adapted by the
heading: 2. Ceaptar an 10ú lá de Dheireadh Fómhair 2022 mar an lá a thiocfaidh alt
text_raw:
2. Ceaptar an 10ú lá de Dheireadh Fómhair 2022 mar an lá a thiocfaidh alt 
6 d’Acht na dTeangacha Oifigiúla (Leasú), 2021 (Uimh. 49 de 2021) i ngníomh. 

ARNA THABHAIRT faoi mo Shéala Oifigiúil, 

3 deireadh Fómhair, 2022. 

CATHERINE MARTIN, 

Aire Turasóireachta, Cultúir, Ealaíon, Gaeltachta, Spóirt 

agus Meán. 

Foilsíodh fógra san “Iris Oifigiúil” an 14 deireadh Fómhair, 2022, á rá go 
ndearnadh an Ionstraim Reachtúil seo. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Official Translation / Tiontú Oifigiúil 

STATUTORY INSTRUMENTS. 

S.I. No. 511 of 2022 

________________ 

OFFICIAL LANGUAGES (AMENDMENT) ACT 2021 
(COMMENCEMENT) (NO. 2) ORDER 2022 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [511] 

Official Translation / Tiontú Oifigiúil 

S.I. No. 511 of 2022 

OFFICIAL LANGUAGES (AMENDMENT) ACT 2021 
(COMMENCEMENT) (NO. 2) ORDER 2022 

I, CATHERINE MARTIN, Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport 
and Media, in exercise of the powers conferred on me by section 20(3) of the 
Official Languages (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 49 of 2021) (as adapted by the 
Culture, Heritage and the Gaeltacht (Alteration of Name of Department and Title 
of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 403 of 2020)), hereby order as follows:
text_norm: 2 ceaptar 10u la de dheireadh fomhair 2022 mar la thiocfaidh alt 6 acht na dteangacha oifigiula (leasu) 2021 (uimh 49 de 2021) ngniomh arna thabhairt faoi mo sheala oifigiuil 3 deireadh fomhair 2022 catherine martin aire turasoireachta cultuir ealaion gaeltachta spoirt agus mean foilsiodh fogra san iris oifigiuil 14 deireadh fomhair 2022 ra go ndearnadh ionstraim reachtuil seo official translation tiontu oifigiuil statutory instrument s.i no 511 2022 official language (amendment) act 2021 (commencement) (no 2) order 2022 4 511 official translation tiontu oifigiuil s.i no 511 2022 official language (amendment) act 2021 (commencement) (no 2) order 2022 catherine martin minister tourism culture art gaeltacht sport medium exercise power conferred section 20(3) official language (amendment) act 2021 (no 49 2021) (as adapted culture heritage gaeltacht (alteration name department title minister) order 2020 (s.i no 403 2020)) hereby order follows

title: Official Languages (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 49 of 2021) (as adapted by the
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Official Languages (Amendment) Act
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Official Languages (Amendment) Act 

2021 (Commencement) (No. 2) Order 2022.
text_norm: 1 order may cited official language (amendment) act 2021 (commencement) (no 2) order 2022

title: Official Languages (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 49 of 2021) (as adapted by the
heading: 2. The 10th day of October 2022 is appointed as the day on which section 6
text_raw:
2. The 10th day of October 2022 is appointed as the day on which section 6 
of the Official Languages (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 49 of 2021) shall come 
into operation. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

3 October, 2022. 

CATHERINE MARTIN, 

Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and 
Media. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th October, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [511] 5
